question: 屋根
sourceMnemonic: The <kanji>root</kanji> of your <kanji>roof</kanji> is still your <vocabulary>roof</vocabulary>. If it helps, imagine roots growing out of your roof. They protect you from the rain.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This word uses the kun'yomi readings. The kun'yomi for <ja>根</ja> is <ja>ね</ja>. For a mnemonic, we'll use the sound a horse makes, <reading>neigh</reading> (<ja>ね</ja>). Why is the horse neigh-ing? It's stuck on the <vocabulary>roof</vocabulary>.
